Generated by DocFX

Class PermissionExtensions

Provides extension methods for handling permissions within the Mewdeko permissions system. These methods extend the functionality of Permissionv2 objects and collections thereof, allowing for checks against messages, users, and specific command or module permissions.

Enumerates through a linked list of permissions starting from the specified permission.

Declaration
public static IEnumerable<Permission> AsEnumerable(this Permission perm)
Parameters
Type Name Description
Permission perm

The starting permission from which to begin enumeration.
Returns
Type Description
IEnumerable<Permission>

An enumerable sequence of permissions, including the starting permission and all subsequent linked permissions.

CheckPermission(Permissionv2, IUserMessage, string, string)

Checks if a specific message has permission based on the detailed permission settings.

Declaration
public static bool? CheckPermission(this Permissionv2 perm, IUserMessage message, string commandName, string moduleName)
Parameters
Type Name Description
Permissionv2 perm

The permission to check against the message.
IUserMessage message

The message that potentially triggers the command.
string commandName

The command name to check permissions against.
string moduleName

The module name to check permissions against.
Returns
Type Description
bool?

True if the permission is applicable and allowed, false if not allowed, or null if not applicable.
| Edit this page View Source

CheckPermissions(IEnumerable<Permissionv2>, IUserMessage, string, string, out int)

Checks if the permissions allow for the execution of a specified command within a message context.

Declaration
public static bool CheckPermissions(this IEnumerable<Permissionv2> permsEnumerable, IUserMessage message, string commandName, string moduleName, out int permIndex)
Parameters
Type Name Description
IEnumerable<Permissionv2> permsEnumerable

An enumerable collection of Permissionv2 objects.
IUserMessage message

The message that potentially triggers the command.
string commandName

The name of the command to check permissions against.
string moduleName

The name of the module containing the command.
int permIndex

Outputs the index of the permission that allowed or denied the command, if applicable.
Returns
Type Description
bool

True if the command is allowed by the permissions; otherwise, false.
Remarks

This method evaluates the permissions in reverse order to prioritize more specific permissions over general ones.

CheckSlashPermission(Permissionv2, string, IUser, string, IMessageChannel)

Checks if a user has permission to execute a slash command based on specific permission settings.

Declaration

The channel in which the slash command was invoked.

True if the permission is applicable and allowed, false if not allowed, or null if not applicable.

CheckSlashPermissions(IEnumerable<Permissionv2>, string, string, IUser, IMessageChannel, out int)

Checks if slash command permissions allow for the execution of a specified command.

Declaration

Type Name Description

An enumerable collection of Permissionv2 objects.

string commandName

The name of the slash command to check permissions against.
IUser user

The user attempting to execute the slash command.
IMessageChannel chan

The channel in which the slash command was invoked.
int permIndex

Outputs the index of the permission that allowed or denied the command, if applicable.
Returns
Type Description
bool

True if the slash command is allowed by the permissions; otherwise, false.
Remarks

Similar to CheckPermissions, but tailored for slash commands and their distinct context.

GetCommand(Permissionv2, string?, SocketGuild?)

Constructs a command string based on the permission settings.

Declaration
public static string GetCommand(this Permissionv2 perm, string? prefix, SocketGuild? guild = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
Permissionv2 perm

The permission for which to construct the command string.
string prefix

The command prefix used by the bot.
SocketGuild guild

Optional. The guild within which the command is relevant. This parameter can affect how user or role identifiers are resolved.
Returns
Type Description
string

A string representing the constructed command based on the permission settings.
